senses.de: A short journey or trip, especially one taken for leisure or pleasure.
senses.ex: We went on an excursion to the beach over the weekend.

Tips.title: Leisure Context
Tips.description: Use 'excursion' when talking about a leisurely adventure or outing, often planned.
Tips.example: Our class is planning an exciting excursion to the science museum.

Tips.title: Planned Event
Tips.description: 'Excursion' implies a trip that is organized in advance and intended for a group.
Tips.example: The tourist agency offers a variety of excursions to local landmarks.

Tips.title: Duration Implied
Tips.description: 'Excursion' suggests a brief duration; it is not usually for extended travel periods.
Tips.example: The family took a weekend excursion to the countryside.

senses.de: A deviation from a regular or set course or standard.
senses.ex: There was a brief excursion into politics before he returned to private life.

Tips.title: Metaphorical Use
Tips.description: Metaphorically, 'excursion' can refer to a temporary deviation in conversation or activity.
Tips.example: The lecture took an interesting excursion into ancient history.

Tips.title: Temporary Change
Tips.description: Use 'excursion' to convey a brief shift from the usual, without significant impact.
Tips.example: The writer made a brief excursion into poetry before returning to novels.

senses.de: A movement of a physical property in one direction.
senses.ex: The excursion of a pendulum is its swinging movement back and forth.

Tips.title: Physical Movement
Tips.description: In a technical context, 'excursion' refers to the movement of something within physical space.
Tips.example: The engineer measured the excursion of the robotic arm.

Tips.title: Scientific Specificity
Tips.description: 'Excursion' in science and engineering precisely describes movement with a start and return.
Tips.example: The oscilloscope traced the excursion of the wave through the medium.

Adventure.wordDefinition:
Adventure implies an exciting and perhaps risky experience, often involving the exploration of the unknown or unexpected.

An adventure could be anything from hiking through an unexplored forest to skydiving.

Adventure refers to an exciting, spontaneous experience while excursion refers to a planned, leisurely activity.

Adventure is suitable for those seeking thrills and excitement, while an excursion is ideal for those looking for a relaxing or educational experience.

Expedition.wordDefinition:
Expedition refers to a more organized and planned journey, typically for a specific purpose, such as scientific research or exploration.

Expeditions require careful planning, often involve a group of people with specific skills or qualifications, and can sometimes last for weeks or even months.

Examples of expeditions could be a mountaineering trip, an archaeological dig, or a wildlife survey.

An excursion is a casual, spontaneous trip taken for leisure, while an expedition is an organized, purposeful journey that requires planning and preparation.

Journey.wordDefinition:
Journey describes a longer trip or voyage that may take several days, weeks, or even months. It usually involves traveling a significant distance from one place to another, often with a specific goal or purpose in mind, such as exploring a new country or visiting friends or family in a distant location.

In simpler terms, an excursion is a short trip taken for fun or educational purposes, while a journey is a longer trip that involves traveling to a specific destination for a specific reason.

Out.wordDefinition:
Excursion refers to a planned trip or outing, usually for leisure, education or culture. It involves going somewhere with a specific purpose in mind, and often involves a group of people.

Out simply means going outside or leaving a place, without necessarily having a specific destination or purpose in mind.

For example, someone might say "I'm going out for a walk" or "I'm going out to get some fresh air".

An excursion is a planned outing with a specific purpose, while out just means leaving a place without a specific plan.

Pilgrimage.wordDefinition:
A pilgrimage is a journey to a holy or sacred place, often undertaken for religious or spiritual reasons. It could be a trip to a famous religious site like Mecca, Jerusalem, or Vatican City, or it could involve visiting the birthplace or tomb of a saint or other revered figure.

While both an excursion and a pilgrimage involve traveling to a destination, the purpose and focus of each is different.

An excursion is meant for enjoyment, while a pilgrimage is meant to deepen one's faith or spirituality.

Safari.wordDefinition:
Safari refers to a specific type of excursion, usually associated with wildlife watching in Africa.

Safaris can be organized by specialized travel agencies and involve observing wild animals in their natural habitat.

Safaris can be done on foot or in a vehicle, and often include camping or staying in lodges near the wildlife areas.

In summary, excursions are general outings for various purposes, while safaris are specific types of excursions focused on wildlife watching in Africa.

Tour.wordDefinition:
It usually lasts for a day or less and includes fewer activities than a tour.

A tour is a longer and more structured trip that usually involves visiting multiple locations or attractions.

A tour guide typically leads the group, and there may be specific activities, such as sightseeing, visiting landmarks, or trying local cuisine.

An excursion is a short and focused trip, while a tour is a more extended itinerary that includes multiple activities and places of interest.

Trip.wordDefinition:
An excursion is a short trip, usually made for pleasure and typically to a place nearby. It usually involves a planned activity such as a visit to a museum, a hike, or a picnic.

A trip is a longer journey, often for a specific purpose like a business meeting or vacation, and requires more planning and preparation.

An excursion is a brief and planned outing usually for enjoyment while a trip is a longer journey often for a specific purpose, which requires more preparation and planning.

Voyage.wordDefinition:
Voyage refers to a longer journey, especially by sea, and usually with a destination in mind. It typically involves a larger group of people and may be done for exploration, trade, or migration purposes.

For example, a cruise across the Atlantic or a voyage around the world are both examples of a voyage.

An excursion is a short trip for fun or education, while a voyage is a longer journey that has a specific goal or destination.

quotes.Text: I started when I was 15 years old. And at that time, I was not thinking about changing the world, I was doing graffiti - writing my name everywhere, using the city as a canvas. I was going in the tunnels of Paris, on the rooftops with my friends. Each trip was an excursion, was an adventure.
quotes.Title: French Artist
quotes.Name: JR

quotes.Text: Here ends my forever memorable first High Sierra excursion. I have crossed the Range of Light, surely the brightest and best of all the Lord has built. And, rejoicing in its glory, I gladly, gratefully, hopefully pray I may see it again.
quotes.Title: American Environmentalist
quotes.Name: John Muir

quotes.Text: The problem with fine art is that in most cases people have to make a special excursion to go and look at it: they can't afford to own it. So it isn't really part of their life in the way that music can be.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Brian Eno

quotes.Text: Science and art, or by the same token, poetry and prose differ from one another like a journey and an excursion. The purpose of the journey is its goal, the purpose of an excursion is the process.
quotes.Title: Austrian Poet
quotes.Name: Franz Grillparzer

quotes.Text: Learning should be a joy and full of excitement. It is life's greatest adventure; it is an illustrated excursion into the minds of the noble and the learned.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Taylor Caldwell

quotes.Text: I am a believer in discipline; it takes a lot to do well. You need discipline for those little excursions into the chaotic that make life interesting.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Linda Ronstadt

quotes.Text: Sometimes some of these little side excursions are useful and I manage to fit them in the book somewhere.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Jack Vance

quotes.Text: The home viewing experience is slightly different and there's room for these kinds of extra excursions.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actor
quotes.Name: Ivan Reitman

quotes.Text: The excursion is the same when you go looking for your sorrow as when you go looking for your joy.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Eudora Welty

quotes.Text: I like going on adventures or excursions.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Hilary Knight
